item.title: 澳大利亚针对 16 岁以下儿童的社交媒体禁令将如何实施？
item.description: 从 12 月 10 日起，根据新的立法，澳大利亚的青少年将被禁止使用 Facebook、Instagram 和 TikTok 等社交媒体平台。【原文：From Dec. 10, young teenagers in Australia will be banned, under new legislation, from social media platforms such as Facebook, Instagram and TikTok — in one of the toughest online crackdowns in the democratic world.】

item.title: 腾讯人工智能老将为成立一年的 OpenAI 竞争对手 Sora 筹集资金
item.description: 这位负责腾讯控股有限公司旗舰人工智能模型开发的科学家为一家初创公司筹集了 5000 万美元，该公司计划推出一款可与 OpenAI 的 Sora 匹敌的产品，这是人工智能领域中利润较高的领域中最新的高调进入者。【原文：The scientist who oversaw development of Tencent Holdings Ltd.’s flagship AI model has raised $50 million with a startup planning to release a rival to OpenAI’s Sora, the latest high-profile entry in one of the more profitable of artificial intelligence spheres.】

item.title: 中国总理称五年内经济总量将超过 23.9 万亿美元
item.description: 中国国务院总理李强表示，中国经济有望在五年内超过 170 万亿元人民币（23.9 万亿美元），并称中国是全球公司不断增长的市场，因为中国政府正努力减轻人们对其贸易不平衡的担忧。【原文：Chinese Premier Li Qiang said his country’s economy is expected to surpass 170 trillion yuan ($23.9 trillion) in five years, touting China as a growing market for global companies as Beijing seeks to mitigate concerns over its trade imbalances.】

item.title: 比特币 "鲸鱼 "抛售 450 亿美元赌注，加密货币遭受重创
item.description: 比特币再次下跌—但这次不是杠杆打破了市场。【原文：Bitcoin has been falling again — but this time, it’s not leverage breaking the market.】

item.title: 日本交易商三井物产将回购最多 2,000 亿日元的股票
item.description: 日本贸易公司三井物产株式会社（Mitsui & Co.【原文：Japanese trading firm Mitsui & Co. will buy back as much as 200 billion yen ($1.3 billion) worth of shares in order to boost shareholder returns and improve capital efficiency.】

item.title: 资产管理公司 TCW 对部分私人信贷业务 "非常紧张
item.description: TCW Group Inc. 的首席执行官表示，她对部分私人信贷感到 "非常紧张"，并加入了金融界领袖的行列，对该资产类别敲响了警钟。【原文：TCW Group Inc.’s chief executive officer said she’s “very nervous” about parts of private credit, joining a chorus of financial leaders who are sounding the alarm on the asset class.】

item.title: 台风 "卡尔玛 "威胁越南，造成菲律宾 59 人死亡
item.description: 台风 "卡尔梅吉 "在菲律宾造成 59 人死亡，近 50 万人流离失所。【原文：Typhoon Kalmaegi killed 59 people and displaced nearly half a million more in the Philippines as it tracks a path toward Vietnam.】

item.title: 担忧加剧，全球芯片大跌抹去 5000 亿美元价值
item.description: 由于担心人工智能热潮中一些最大赢家的估值过高，全球半导体股票正在加速下挫。【原文：The global selloff in semiconductor stocks is accelerating on concern over lofty valuations for some of the artificial intelligence boom’s biggest winners.】

item.title: 铜在上周创下历史纪录后连续第五天下跌
item.description: 铜在上月底创下历史新高后连续第五天下跌，全球股市的大跌也削弱了投资者对大宗商品的兴趣。【原文：Copper dropped a fifth day after reaching a record late last month, as a selloff across global stock markets also dimmed investor appetite for commodities.】

item.title: 据说动物饲料生产商海德将为香港上市挑选银行
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，中国动物和鱼类饲料生产商广东海德集团股份有限公司已为其计划中的香港上市挑选了银行。【原文：Guangdong Haid Group Co., a Chinese producer of animal and fish feed, has picked banks for its planned Hong Kong listing, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 股票回调让投资者争论跌势会有多深
item.description: 美国股市一个月来的最大跌幅让投资者开始质疑，长期以来对科技股估值过高、市场广度狭窄和经济不确定性的担忧是否会最终导致始于四月份的牛市行情终结。【原文：The biggest slump in a month for US stocks is leading investors to question whether long-running concerns over lofty tech valuations, narrow market breadth and economic uncertainty will finally bring an end to the bull run that started in April.】

item.title: 即使经济放缓，中国服务业指标仍延续增长势头
item.description: 一项民间调查显示，上个月中国服务业活动的增长符合预期，原因是家庭的假日消费和旅游使服务业免受经济放缓的影响。【原文：China’s services activity grew in line with expectations last month, a private survey showed, as holiday spending and travel by households insulated the industry from an economic slowdown.】

item.title: 日本央行会议记录凸显植根于日本通货紧缩时代的谨慎态度
item.description: 根据 9 月份的会议记录，一些日本央行董事会成员在讨论加息时机时提到，由于日本长期经历通货紧缩，因此需要谨慎行事，他们反驳了两位要求加息的成员。【原文：Some Bank of Japan board members debating the timing for a rate hike cited the need for caution owing to the nation’s prolonged experience with deflation, pushing back against two who called for a hike, according to minutes from the September meeting.】

item.title: 日本日经 225 指数暴跌 4%，科技板块领跌
item.description: 日本股市在科技股的带动下创下六个多月来的最大跌幅，估值过高的担忧日益加剧，导致全球股市低迷。【原文：Japanese stocks dropped the most in over six months, led by tech shares, amid a global slump driven by mounting concerns of excessive valuations.】

item.title: 随着汽车制造商在香港上市，Seres 走出华为的阴影
item.description: 多年来，Seres 集团公司依靠中国技术冠军华为技术有限公司，将一家廉价面包车装配商转变为中国最畅销豪华车的制造商。现在，它已准备好自立门户。【原文：For years, Seres Group Co. leaned on Chinese technology champion Huawei Technologies Co. to transform an assembler of cheap minivans into the maker of the country’s top-selling luxury vehicle. Now, it’s ready to come into its own.】

item.title: 菲律宾 10 月通胀稳定，可能支持降息
item.description: 菲律宾的通货膨胀率在 10 月份趋于稳定，保持在中央银行的目标范围以下，可能支持基准利率的进一步下调。【原文：Inflation in the Philippines steadied in October, staying below the central bank’s target range and may support further cuts in benchmark interest rates.】

item.title: 卢拉预计将暂别 COP30，讨论委内瑞拉问题
item.description: 路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦总统预计将从他在巴西主办的联合国气候峰会中抽身，参加本周末在哥伦比亚举行的有关委内瑞拉危机的讨论。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva is expected to take a break from the United Nations climate summit he’s hosting in Brazil to join discussions on the Venezuela crisis in Colombia this weekend.】

item.title: 美国经济从绿色退市中获胜，除非世界各国纷纷效仿
item.description:
彭博经济学研究人员写道，如果全球集体放弃绿色政策，全球经济将萎缩。【原文：

If the world collectively retreated from green policies, the global economy would shrink, Bloomberg Economics researchers write. 

】

item.title: 森信托首席执行官为日本的公寓式酒店寻求外国合作伙伴
item.description: 森信托株式会社首席执行官表示，该公司正在寻找海外合作伙伴，以便在日本推出可以像酒店客房一样出租的公寓，从而从日本旅游业的繁荣中获利。【原文：Mori Trust Co. is looking for overseas partners to launch condominiums in Japan that can be rented out like hotel rooms, its chief executive officer said, as the company seeks to profit from the nation’s tourism boom.】

item.title: 投资者权衡美元和美国利率前景，黄金维持跌势
item.description: 美元升至 5 月份以来的最高点，抑制了需求，黄金创下一周多来的最大跌幅。【原文：Gold held the biggest drop in more than a week after the US dollar rose to the highest since May, blunting demand.】

item.title: 估值担忧冲击科技股，韩国 Kospi 指数暴跌
item.description: 由于对估值的担忧打击了芯片股、国防和造船企业等近期的赢家，韩国股票基准大幅下滑。【原文：South Korea’s equity benchmark slumped as valuation concerns hammered recent winners such as chip stocks, defense and shipbuilders.】

item.title: 伊塔乌预计 "可预见的未来 "拖欠率将保持低位
item.description: Itau Unibanco Holding SA 预计未来几个季度的信贷质量将保持稳定，该银行在巴西投资组合中的拖欠率将继续低于全国的总体拖欠率。【原文：Itau Unibanco Holding SA is expecting its credit quality to stay stable over the next few quarters, with delinquencies within the bank’s Brazilian portfolio set to remain below overall rates across the country.】

item.title: 英国经济研究局（NIESR）称，里夫斯必须实现盈余才能阻止英国债务激增
item.description: 一家领先的经济智库警告说，英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）需要实现基本预算盈余，以控制英国 "不可持续 "的债务轨迹。【原文：Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves needs to run primary budget surpluses, a feat Britain last achieved quarter of a century ago, to get a grip on the country’s “unsustainable” debt trajectory, a leading economic think tank warned.】

item.title: 英国里夫斯将会见保险业首席执行官，进行预算前增长推介
item.description: 英国财政大臣雷切尔-里夫斯（Rachel Reeves）将于周三在唐宁街会见顶级保险公司的首席执行官们，她将在本月晚些时候的棘手预算案出台前，努力鼓励在金融城进行更多投资。【原文：UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves will meet CEOs from top insurers in Downing Street on Wednesday, as she seeks to encourage more investment in the City ahead of a tricky budget later this month.】

item.title: 政策困境导致外国资金外流，印尼债券受到冲击
item.description: 上个月，外国投资者再次抛售印尼政府债券，这凸显了人们对政府增加开支和提高赤字限额计划的担忧。【原文：Foreign investors sold Indonesian government bonds again last month, underscoring concerns over the government’s plans to increase spending and raise the deficit limit.】

item.title: 黑石支持的食品卫生清洁公司签订锻炼协议
item.description: 据熟悉情况的人士透露，Blackstone Inc.支持的 Fortrex 已达成重组协议，贷款人将控制这家陷入困境的食品卫生清洁公司。【原文：Blackstone Inc.-backed Fortrex has reached a restructuring agreement in which lenders will take control of the troubled food sanitation facilities cleaner, according to people familiar with the situation.】

item.title: 慧聪网支持的保险科技公司 Exzeo Group 首次公开募股融资 1.68 亿美元
item.description: 由 HCI 集团公司支持的保险技术公司 Exzeo Group Inc.【原文：Exzeo Group Inc., an insurance technology firm backed by HCI Group Inc., raised $168 million in an initial public offering that priced at the midpoint of its marketed range, joining a handful of firms going public during the government shutdown.】

item.title: 日本电产获得 39 亿美元信贷额度，缓解流动性担忧
item.description: 日本电产株式会社从日本 MUFG 银行和 SMBC 获得了 6000 亿日元（39 亿美元）的信贷额度，缓解了人们对这家精密电机制造商在会计问题调查期间可能出现流动性紧张的担忧。【原文：Nidec Corp. secured a ¥600 billion ($3.9 billion) credit line from MUFG Bank Ltd. and SMBC, easing concerns about potential liquidity strains at the maker of precision motors amid an ongoing probe into accounting issues.】

item.title: First Brands 创始人被控洗劫公司
item.description: 起初，销售发票上写的是 179.84 美元。后来，账单上写着 9 271.25 美元--多了 50 倍。【原文：At first, the sales invoice said $179.84. Later, the bill said $9,271.25 – 50 times more.】

item.title: 印度 ChrysCapital 募集 22 亿美元，成为其最大基金
item.description: ChrysCapital Management Co. 公司以 22 亿美元完成了第 10 支私募股权基金的募集，打破了之前的记录，该公司正在工业和医疗保健领域寻求更多交易。【原文：ChrysCapital Management Co. closed its 10th private equity fund at $2.2 billion, beating its previous record as it hunts for more deals in industrials and health care.】
